"text editor" is for plain text and is not cooperative.
"documents" is the cooperative editor.

which one was acting weird ?

need to try this out to find out what's wrong with mime type to app mapping.
seems the file actions issue (point 2) was already reported as #6427

@hlx98007 i tried installing oc 6.0.0a from scratch and uploading a ".7z" file.
clicking on it doesn't open the editor but downloads the file.
the "text editor" and "documents" apps are enabled.

@pvince81 hi, would you be able to look at this problem please? what else do you need?

i just tried upload a djvu file with 6.0.0a, then i refreshed the page, then i clicked on the file: it is downloaded.
would be good if you could give additional info using the issue template: https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md

can you use your browser's dom inspector and read the "data-mime" attribute of the djvu file's "tr" element.

@pvince81 the data-mime attribute shows it's a text/plain file. 7z is also a text/plain file.

### expected behaviour
djvu and 7z files should not be recognized as text/plain.

### actual behaviour
mime type detection error on some extension

### steps to reproduce
it looks like it happens just for me...

### server configuration
operating system: centos 6.5

web server: nginx

database: mariadb 5.5

php version: 5.4.23

owncloud version: 6.0.0a stable

updated from an older owncloud or fresh install: 
upgrade install with configuration file (config.php) copied from old owncloud 5.13

list of activated app: 
calendar
contacts
deleted files
documents
encryption
full text search
pdf viewer
pictures
share files

updater
versions
video viewer
videos
